p: A significant part of this paper deals with the need to go beyond certain approaches and logics, identified as the key barriers to just transformations in the EU bioeconomy, and with alternative approaches and logics to facilitate such transformations (“Drawing on DEJ and degrowth to identify barriers to and alternatives for socioecological justice and transformations”). Rather than proposing far-fetched policy recommendations for more transformational and more just politics in the EU bioeconomy policy domain, in what follows I reflect upon the process of change and risks of co-optation, with a hope to inspire decolonial and just socioecological transformations in and beyond bioeconomy.
